descriptionNullable:
### Context

The dataset is organized into 3 folders (train, test, val) and contains subfolders for each image category (Type A1, C1, D1 and Others). There are 841 Shoulder X-Ray images (PNG) and 4 categories (Type A1, C1, D1 and Others).


### Content

Shoulder X-ray images (anterior-posterior) were selected from retrospective cohorts of pediatric patients of 40 to 70 years old from Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University, Guangzhou. All Shlouder X-ray imaging was performed as part of patients’ routine clinical care.

For the analysis of shoulder x-ray images, all chest radiographs were initially screened for quality control by removing all low quality or unreadable scans. The diagnoses for the images were then graded by two expert physicians before being cleared for training the AI system. In order to account for any grading errors, the evaluation set was also checked by a third expert.


### Acknowledgements

License: CC BY 4.0


Purpose:

To develop a deep learning algorithmto for classify the anteroposterior radiographs of the shoulder with can achieve 98% accuracy, 98% precision, and 98% recall.
title: Shoulder X-ray Classification
subtitle: Shoulder X-ray Classification
description:
### Context

The dataset is organized into 3 folders (train, test, val) and contains subfolders for each image category (Type A1, C1, D1 and Others). There are 841 Shoulder X-Ray images (PNG) and 4 categories (Type A1, C1, D1 and Others).

Shoulder X-ray images (anterior-posterior) were selected from retrospective cohorts of pediatric patients of 40 to 70 years old from Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University, Guangzhou. All Shlouder X-ray imaging was performed as part of patients’ routine clinical care.

For the analysis of shoulder x-ray images, all chest radiographs were initially screened for quality control by removing all low quality or unreadable scans. The diagnoses for the images were then graded by two expert physicians before being cleared for training the AI system. In order to account for any grading errors, the evaluation set was also checked by a third expert.
